enhance_mandate_visibility_and_design.text: Accelerate the creation of comprehensive registries of existing mandate texts issued by all mandating bodies
Improve Secretariat support for Member States during mandate creation, based on priorities established by Member States
Strengthen support by United Nations entities to coordinate and promote greater visibility across the work of mandating bodies

Develop tools using artificial intelligence to assist with mandate drafting, including by producing summarized information to enable Member States' decision-making, flagging potential complementarities or duplications in draft texts or meeting agendas across mandating bodies

For new mandates, complement estimates of regular budget expenditures prepared by the Secretary-General (in accordance with rule 153 of the rules of procedure of the General Assembly) with additional information on related programmatic activities across the United Nations system and across all sources of funding

improve_reporting.text: Provide shorter reports and reduce maximum word counts
Combine reports covering similar issues and contexts wherever feasible
Introduce different report formats based on needs and content type; first reports could be longer, followed by shorter updates, visual dashboards, in-person briefings or other formats
Publish download statistics for all reports to inform further discussions on reporting practices

improve_mandate_delivery_management.text: Strengthen internal strategic oversight of the United Nations system division of labour at all levels to ensure effective, efficient programmatic and operational support. This builds on the 2018 reform commitments and efforts to strengthen resident coordinator system leadership
Ensure that United Nations entities review mandate citations in their programmes and budgets so that entities cite only those mandates for which they have demonstrable comparative advantages

Make better use of system-wide coordination platforms (e.g. Inter-Agency Standing Committee, United Nations Sustainable Development Group and United Nations System Chief Executives Board for Coordination) to avoid duplication and ensure the strategic use of resources across the United Nations system
Fully apply all commitments by the United Nations system through the funding compact and strengthen dialogue to this end

establish_effective_review_mechanisms.text: Increase the use of existing mechanisms to identify opportunities to consolidate and streamline work, including recommendations by the Secretary-General to terminate specific outputs (in accordance with staff rule 105.6 of ST/SGB/2018/3)
Strengthen and harmonize management for results mechanisms across the United Nations system, including how results are measured and communicated

effective_mandate_design.text: Reduce the length of mandate texts wherever possible in order to ensure that mandates are implemented effectively and with greater impact (in line with the recommendations in paragraph 45 of General Assembly resolution 77/335)
Frame mandates that allow the Secretary-General appropriate flexibility to assign tasks based on comparative advantages and resources across the United Nations system
Refrain from mandating new tasks that are not backed by corresponding resources or an explicit reduction in other mandated tasks

improve_mandate_delivery.text: Prioritize and streamline requests in mandates for reports or meetings
Fully apply all commitments by Member States through the funding compact and strengthen dialogue to this end
Allow United Nations system entities greater flexibility to redeploy resources quickly with reasonable justification, including to protect essential country-level delivery from funding cuts
Consider implementing relevant forthcoming recommendations from the UN80 Initiative workstream on structural changes and programme realignment

support_mandate_review.text: Systematize and reinforce efforts under way to strengthen mandate review mechanisms and ensure that these efforts are in place across mandating bodies
Include expiry clauses in new resolutions (as recommended in General Assembly resolution 77/335)

Introduce processes to facilitate more collective reviews of mandates that address specific issues, learning from existing practices (e.g. General Assembly revitalization) and similar processes (e.g. the quadrennial comprehensive policy review)

Streamline how mandates are discussed, including by revising intergovernmental bodies' programmes of work, consolidating agenda items of individual bodies and aligning work across the General Assembly, the Economic and Social Council and the Security Council

structural_reforms.label: Entity Mergers and Structural Consolidation
structural_reforms.description: Assessing potential mergers, consolidations, and sunsetting of UN entities (e.g., UNDP–UNOPS, UNFPA–UN Women) to reduce duplication and improve impact, subject to intergovernmental decisions and rigorous cost–benefit analyses

structural_reforms.label: Special Envoys and Senior Posts Review
structural_reforms.description: Evaluating the system of special envoys and senior posts to reduce fragmentation and top-heaviness, clarify roles, and safeguard mission effectiveness

structural_reforms.label: Staffing Diversity and Geographic Balance
structural_reforms.description: Ensuring reforms uphold gender parity, equitable geographical representation, and fair staffing outcomes, including avoiding disproportionate cuts to junior posts

structural_reforms.label: Function Relocation and Cost Savings
structural_reforms.description: Exploration of moving back-office functions from higher- to lower-cost duty stations to balance cost, operational effectiveness, and proximity needs

structural_reforms.label: UN Decentralization to Field Operations
structural_reforms.description: Exploring relocation of agency operations to lower-cost, field-based hubs to enhance cost-effectiveness, subject to agency boards and member state processes

pillar_specific_reforms.label: Human Rights Architecture
pillar_specific_reforms.description: Proposals to establish and streamline human rights coordination (e.g., a Human Rights Group, special procedures, treaty body processes) while safeguarding mandates and ensuring intergovernmental oversight

pillar_specific_reforms.label: Humanitarian Compact and Operational Efficiency
pillar_specific_reforms.description: Improving humanitarian operations through joint supply chain pilots, shared data efforts, and aligned planning instruments to deliver faster, more coordinated responses

pillar_specific_reforms.label: Peace Operations Realignment
pillar_specific_reforms.description: Redistributing civilian mandates to appropriate UN entities, co-locating advisory capacities with regional commissions, and strengthening prevention, peacebuilding, and peace support

pillar_specific_reforms.label: Peacebuilding Integration
pillar_specific_reforms.description: Integrating peacebuilding and peacekeeping, including a unified Peace Building and Peace Support Office and potential centers of excellence, to reduce silos and strengthen prevention

pillar_specific_reforms.label: Women, Peace and Security
pillar_specific_reforms.description: Advancing and integrating the WPS agenda across UN peace and security work and ensuring gender equality efforts are strengthened, coordinated and protected in reforms

pillar_specific_reforms.label: Rule of Law Coordination
pillar_specific_reforms.description: Aligning and streamlining UN rule-of-law assistance across entities to reduce fragmentation, clarify roles, and deliver more efficient, impact-oriented support

operational_delivery.label: Regional Reset and Integrated Platforms
operational_delivery.description: Redesigning regional capacities and integrated platforms to improve coherence and delivery across pillars, with clear scope, costs, and impacts—especially for Africa and vulnerable regions

operational_delivery.label: UN Country Team Reconfiguration and RC System
operational_delivery.description: Adjusting UN country team configurations and strengthening the Resident Coordinator system to enhance on-the-ground impact while respecting national ownership and host government priorities

operational_delivery.label: Field-Level Impact and Coherence
operational_delivery.description: Refocusing reforms to improve delivery and coordination on the ground, empowering Resident/Humanitarian Coordinators, harmonizing country-level mechanisms, and reducing duplication in complex operational settings

operational_delivery.label: Integrated Delivery Across Pillars
operational_delivery.description: Shift from fragmented and parallel efforts to an integrated, complementary approach across the peace, development and humanitarian pillars, managing interdependencies holistically

thematic_priorities.label: Development Pillar Priority
thematic_priorities.description: Ensuring the development pillar remains central to UN80 reforms, with tailored support to developing countries and stronger delivery on the SDGs at country and regional levels

thematic_priorities.label: SDG Delivery Reform
thematic_priorities.description: Strengthening the UN development system to deliver the Sustainable Development Goals by improving coherence, effectiveness and impact while safeguarding the development pillar and country-level support

thematic_priorities.label: Support for LDCs, LLDCs and SIDS
thematic_priorities.description: Prioritizing tailored development support, expertise and strong field presence for countries in special situations, ensuring equity and avoiding reduced capacity in vulnerable regions

thematic_priorities.label: Africa Prioritization
thematic_priorities.description: Protecting and advancing mandates that prioritize Africa and deepening UN–African Union cooperation, recognizing the continent's specific needs and Security Council focus

thematic_priorities.label: Three Pillars Balance
thematic_priorities.description: Safeguarding the balance among peace and security, development, and human rights so reforms enhance all pillars without encroachment

technology_and_services.label: Data Commons and Joint Knowledge Hubs
technology_and_services.description: Developing system-wide data standards and joint knowledge hubs to share expertise, enable cross-pillar solutions, and support evidence-based decision-making

technology_and_services.label: Technology and Data Modernization
technology_and_services.description: Creating a UN System Data Commons and a technology accelerator platform, consolidating IT and leveraging digital tools and AI to reduce duplication, modernize operations and improve delivery

technology_and_services.label: Shared Services and Procurement Reform
technology_and_services.description: Scaling shared services, simplifying planning, and integrating supply chains to improve efficiency and reduce costs

specific_entities.label: UNAIDS Future/Transition
specific_entities.description: Debate over the proposed early sunset of UNAIDS and transfer of its functions, with concerns about jeopardizing national HIV responses and global health goals
